{"step_by_step_thinking": "The mandibular nerve is the third division of the trigeminal nerve and it carries both sensory and motor fibers. The anterior division of the mandibular nerve contains mainly motor fibers that supply the temporalis, lateral pterygoid, and masseter muscles. However, it also has a sensory branch, the long buccal nerve.", "answer_choice": "A. One sensory and all motor branches"}
